page.title: 01Sealand,Shotwick,Saughall
page.content: Our area consists of three main places.The largest being Sealand,consisting of the new village of Garden City,and also the large land area of the Royal Air Force camp at Sealand.The oldest part is that of Shotwick and its very old church dating back to Domesday times.Our area also includes a very small part of the village of Saughall.Our area is very flat,if anything it is in a very shallow valley,that valley being the old river bed of the wide River Dee,it is the tract which the River Dee Company in the second half of the eighteenth century reclaimed or redeemed when it cut a new channel for the River Dee,and erected in embankment in order to improve the navigation of the{Dee Estuary so that shipping could still go up as far as the very old city of Chester.
